argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Given JobStore is not ethereum fundable."

nodes.documentation: @dev Main method for funding ethereum to the given JobStore.
nodes.name: fund

arguments.value: Not Implemented

nodes.name: fundToken

fund().details: Main method for funding ethereum to the given JobStore.

fundToken(address,uint256).details: Overload for funding the JobStore with an ERC20 token

params.amount: The amount of tokens to transfer to the current JobStore contract.
params.tokenAddress: Address of the ERC20 token contract.

getRequestedArbiterByIndex(uint256).details: Get the arbiter request data in the arbiter request listing.

params.index: The index of the ArbiterRequest within the listing.

getRequestedArbiterCount().details: Returns the number of requested arbiters for this job contract

getWorkContractByIndex(uint256).details: Returns the WorkContract address at the given index.

params.index: The index of the Work Contract to be retrieved.

getWorkContractCount().details: Get the current number of work contracts
getWorkContractCount().return: The number of work contracts in the job store.

payInvoice(address,uint256).details: Main function for paying an invoice, propagated up from EthlanceInvoice.

params.amountPaid: The amount paid to the given candidateAddress in Wei.
params.candidateAddress: The address of the person acquiring the payout.

payInvoice(address,uint256,address).details: Main function for paying an invoice with an ERC20 token, propagated from EthlanceInvoice.

params.amountPaid: The amount paid to the given candidateAddress based on the ERC20 token contract amount.
params.candidateAddress: The address of the person acquiring the payout.
params.tokenAddress: Address of the ERC20 token contract.

requestArbiter(address).details: Add an arbiter to the arbiter request listing.

params.arbiterAddress: The user address of the arbiter.

requestWorkContract(address).details: Request and create a pending contract between the Candidate and the Employer

params.candidateAddress: The user address of the Candidate.

resolveDispute(uint256,address,uint256,a.details: Main function for resolving a dispute between an employer and a candidate.

params.employerAmount: Amount to give the employer for dispute resolution.

devdoc.title: Create Job Contracts as an assigned Employer as a group of identical contracts.
